Rename PDi-TAB\u00AE2
An app wants to make your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 visible to other Bluetooth devices for %1$d seconds.
An app wants to make your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 visible to other Bluetooth devices. You can change this later in Bluetooth settings.
An app wants to turn on Bluetooth and make your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 visible to other devices for %1$d seconds.
An app wants to turn on Bluetooth and make your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 visible to other devices. You can change this later in Bluetooth settings.
PDi-TAB\u00AE2 info
Encrypt PDi-TAB\u00AE2

You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your PDi-TAB\u00AE2, you need to type a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on. You can\'t decrypt your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 except by performing a factory data reset, erasing all your data.\n\nEncryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 plugged in until encryption is complete. If you interrupt the encryption process, you will lose some or all of your data.
Encrypt PDi-TAB\u00AE2
The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you\'ll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the PDi-TAB\u00AE2 will restart several times.

Encryption was interrupted and can\'t complete. As a result, the data on your tablet is no longer accessible. \n\n To resume using your PDi-TAB\u00AE2, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 after the reset, you\'ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.
%1$s will be disconnected from sharing this PDi-TAB\u00AE2\'s Internet connection.
Allow data exchange when the PDi-TAB\u00AE2 touches another device
To complete setup, your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 needs access to Wi\u2011Fi. After setup, you can switch between ethernet data and Wi\u2011Fi.
WARNING: You may incur extra carrier data charges.\n\nPDi-TAB\u00AE2 setup can require significant network activity.
WARNING: Until you have an internet connection, the PDi-TAB\u00AE2 won\'t be able to verify that your software is up to date.
The PDi-TAB\u00AE2 was unable to connect to this Wi\u2011Fi network.
PDi-TAB\u00AE2 not docked
You need to dock the PDi-TAB\u00AE2 before setting up dock audio.

Don\'t play sound when inserting or removing PDi-TAB\u00AE2 from dock

Erases all data on PDi-TAB\u00AE2

"This will erase all data from your PDi-TAB®2's internal storage, including:


Your system level accounts

System and app data and settings

Downloaded apps"

Let apps use GPS on your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 to pinpoint your location
About PDi-TAB\u00AE2

Your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 and personal data are more vulnerable to attack by apps from unknown sources. You agree that you are solely responsible for any damage to your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 or loss of data that may result from using these apps.
This app can access the following on your PDi-TAB\u00AE2:
This app can access the following on your PDi-TAB\u00AE2. In order to improve performance and reduce memory usage, some of these permissions are available to %1$s
Move to PDi-TAB\u00AE2
If you stop this service, some features of your PDi-TAB\u00AE2 may stop working correctly until you power it off and then on again.
PDi-TAB\u00AE2 information
PDi-TAB\u00AE2 idle
PDi-TAB\u00AE2
Battery used when PDi-TAB\u00AE2 is idle
Removing this account will delete all of its messages, contacts, and other data from the PDi-TAB\u00AE2!
This account is required by some apps. You can only remove it by resetting the PDi-TAB\u00AE2 to factory defaults (which deletes all your personal data) in Settings > Backup & reset.

Any changes you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your PDi-TAB®2.

Some accounts may also automatically copy any changes you make on the PDi-TAB®2 to the web. A Google Account works this way.

To choose which kinds of information to sync within each account, go to Settings > Accounts.

Your mobile data connection will be disabled when the specified limit is reached.\n\nSince data usage is measured by your PDi-TAB\u00AE2, and your carrier may account for usage differently, consider using a conservative limit.
If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won\'t work unless you\'re connected to an ethernet or Wi\u2011Fi network.\n\nThis setting affects all users on this PDi-TAB\u00AE2.
%2$s: about %1$s used, as measured by your PDi-TAB\u00AE2. Your carrier\'s data usage accounting may differ.

You can share this device with other people by creating additional users. Each user has their own space, which they can customize with their own apps, wallpaper, and so on. Users can also adjust PDi-TAB®2 settings like Wi‑Fi that affect everyone.

After you create a new user, that person needs to go through a setup process.

Any user can accept updated app permissions on behalf of all other users.
Make sure the person is available to take the PDi-TAB\u00AE2 and set up their space
Only the PDi-TAB\u00AE2\'s owner can manage users.
You will lose your space and data on this PDi-TAB\u00AE2. You can\'t undo this action.
This user\'s space and data will disappear from this PDi-TAB\u00AE2. You can\'t undo this action.
This profile\'s space and data will disappear from this PDi-TAB\u00AE2. You can\'t undo this action.
This setting affects all users on this PDi-TAB\u00AE2.
